member.name: T:wclCommon.wclErrors
member.summary: The static class contains all the WCL error codes.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_SUCCESS
member.summary: Operation completed with success.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_BASE
member.summary: The base error code for the WCL system/common errors.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT
member.summary: One or more arguments passed into the method or function are invalid.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_OUT_OF_MEMORY
member.summary: Out of system memory.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_BASE
member.summary: The base error code for the message receiver.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_CLOSED
member.summary: A message receiver has already been closed or not opened.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_OPENED
member.summary: A message receiver has already been opened.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_NOT_OPENED
member.summary: A message receiver was not opened yet.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_UNABLE_SYNCHRONIZE
member.summary: A message receiver can not synchronize threads and notify a "main" thread about new received message.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_UNABLE_REGISTER_SYNC_OBJ
member.summary: A message receiver can not register for threads synchronization.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_UNABLE_CREATE_SYNC_OBJ
member.summary: A message receiver can not create a thread synchronization object.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_SYNC_OBJ_NOT_CREATED
member.summary: A thread synchronization object has not been created.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_INVALID_THREAD
member.summary: An invalid thread used to call the method.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_UNABLE_CREATE_TERM_EVENT
member.summary: Unable to create asynchronous message processing thread termination event.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_INVALID_MESSAGE_PROCESSING_METHOD
member.summary: Invalid or unsupported message processing method.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_BASE
member.summary: The base error code for the message broadcaster.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_RECEIVER_ALREADY_SUBSCRIBED
member.summary: A message receiver has already been subscribed.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_RECEIVER_NOT_SUBSCRIBED
member.summary: A message receiver has not been subscribed.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_CAN_NOT_INIT_HW_THREAD
member.summary: The message broadcaster can not initialize the hardware monitoring thread.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_CAN_NOT_START_HW_THREAD
member.summary: The message broadcaster can not start the hardware monitoring thread.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_UNABLE_CREATE_HW_OBJ
member.summary: The message broadcaster can not create the hardware monitoring object.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_UNABLE_REGISTER_HW_NOTIFY
member.summary: The message broadcaster can not register for hardware changes notifications.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_UNABLE_CREATE_MUTEX
member.summary: The message broadcaster can not create a mutex synchronization object.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_NOT_CREATED
member.summary: The message broadcaster was not created.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_REF_COUNT_ERROR
member.summary: There is the error with the references counter.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_RUNNING
member.summary: The messaging subsystem is already running.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_INVALID_SYNC_METHOD
member.summary: Invalid or unknown synchronization method.

member.summary: A timeout appeared during wait operation.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_WAIT_FAILED

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MB_RECEIVER_NOT_FOUND

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclErrorInformation
member.summary: The class provides methods to get human readable information about Wireless Communication Library errors.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclErrorInformation.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new object.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclErrorInformation.Finalize
member.summary: Free the object.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclErrorInformation.Close
member.summary: Closes the errors description file.
member.returns: True if the method completed with success. False otherwise.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclErrorInformation.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the errors description file.
member.param: Full path (including file name) to the errors.xml file.
member.returns: True if errors file was opened. False otherwise.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclErrorInformation.GetDetails(System.Int32,wclCommon.wclErrorDetails@)
member.summary: Gets the Wireless Communication Library error details.
member.param: If the method completed with success the Details structure will be fulfilled with the specified error details.
member.returns: If the method completed with success the returning value is True. If the method failed the returning value is False.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclErrorInformation.Opened
member.summary: Gets the file state.
member.value: True if the errors description file is opened. False otherwise.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.LoWord(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns Lo Word of the UInt32 value.
member.returns: The Lo Word.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.HiWord(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns Hi Word of the UInt32 value.
member.returns: The Hi Word.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.LoByte(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Returns Lo Byte of the UInt16 value.
member.returns: The Lo Byte.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.HiByte(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Returns Hi Byte of the UInt16 value.
member.returns: The Hi Byte.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.HResultFromWin32(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts Win32 error code into HRESULT.
member.returns: HRESULT value represents the given Win32 error code.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.Succeeded(System.Int32)
member.summary: Provides a generic test for success on any status value.
member.param: The status code. This value can be an HRESULT or an SCODE. A non-negative number indicates success.
member.returns: true if Status represents a success status value; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.Failed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Provides a generic test for failure on any status value.
member.param: The status code. This value can be an HRESULT or an SCODE. A negative number indicates failure.
member.returns: true if Status represents a failed status value; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.IncPtr(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Increments a pointer on given offset.
member.returns: Returns a new pointer.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.ZeroHGlobal(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Zeros the memory allocated by the AllocHGlobal.
member.param: The InPtr returned by the AllocHGlobal method.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.AllocHGlobal(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocates and zeros memory.
member.returns: The IntPtr value for allocated memory or InPtr.Zero in case of out of memory.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclMessageBroadcaster
member.summary: The message broadcaster manages broadcast messages between subscribers (message receivers subscribed for broadcast messages). Also the message broadcaster monitors changes in the hardware configuration and notifies subscribers about the changes.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageBroadcaster.#ctor
member.summary: Create the message broadcaster.
member.remarks: An application must never create the broadcaster directly. It is created when needed by the message receivers.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageBroadcaster.Dispose
member.summary: Frees the message broadcaster.
member.remarks: An application must never destroy the broadcaster directly. It is destroyed when not needed any more by the message receivers.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageBroadcaster.Broadcast(wclCommon.wclMessage)
member.summary: Broadcasts a Message to all message receivers.
member.param: The object represents the message. A caller is responsible to free the Message object after procedure call.
member.returns: If the function succeed the returns value is . Otherwise the function returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageBroadcaster.Post(System.Int32,wclCommon.wclMessage)
member.summary: Posts a Message to a message receiver with specified ID.
member.param: The object represents the message. A caller is responsible to free the Message object after procedure the call.
member.returns: If the function succeed the returns value is . Otherwise the function returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageBroadcaster.ProcessMessages
member.summary: Force WCL message processing for current thread.
member.returns: If the function succeed the returns value is . Otherwise the function returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: This function can be used to force WCL message processing in case if your execution thread is blocked.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclMessage
member.summary: The message object.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessage.Free
member.summary: Frees the message object.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessage.#ctor(System.Byte,wclCommon.wclMessageCategory)
member.summary: Create new message object.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessage.AddRef
member.summary: Increments the reference count of the object. This method should be called for every new reference to the object.
member.returns: The method returns the new reference count. This value is intended to be used only for test purposes.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessage.Release
member.summary: Decrements the reference count for an object.
member.returns: The method returns the new reference count. This value is intended to be used only for test purposes.
member.remarks: When the reference count on an object reaches zero, Release causes the object to free itself. When the released pointer is the only existing reference to an object, the implementation frees the object.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclMessage.Category
member.summary: Gets the message category ID.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclMessage.Id
member.summary: Gets the message ID.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclMessage.Created
member.summary: Gets message created timestamp.
member.value: The timestamp in ticks when the message was created.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclMessage.Queued
member.summary: Gets the message queued timestamp.
member.value: The timestamp in ticks when the message was placed to the messages queue. If the value is 0 then the message was not queued.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclMessage.Processed
member.summary: Gets the message processed timestamp.
member.value: The timestamp on ticks when the message was processed. If the message was not processed the value is 0.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclHardwareChangeMessage
member.summary: The Hardware Changed message is broadcast to all subscribers when changes in the hardware configuration have been detected. The message ID is .

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHardwareChangeMessage.#ctor(System.Guid,System.Guid,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates new Hardware Changed message object.
member.param: true if the device has been inserted.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclHardwareChangeMessage.InterfaceClass
member.summary: Gets the device interface class GUID.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclHardwareChangeMessage.DeviceClass
member.summary: Gets the device class GUID.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclHardwareChangeMessage.Instance
member.summary: Gets the device instance string.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclHardwareChangeMessage.Inserted
member.summary: Gets the device state.
member.value: true if the device has been inserted.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclMessageProcessingMethod
member.summary: Message processing methods used in inter-threading notifications.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclMessageProcessingMethod.mpAsync
member.summary: Asynchronous message processing. All events are called in a separate thread. An application is responsible for the synchronization with UI thread. Must be used carefully.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclMessageProcessingMethod.mpSync
member.summary: Synchronous message processing method based on Windows Messages.
member.remarks: This method is recommended for single threading UI applications.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclMessageEvent
member.summary: The OnMessage event handler prototype.
member.remarks: The Message object is valid only inside an event handler.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver
member.summary: The Wireless Communication Library message receiver.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.DoMessage(wclCommon.wclMessage)
member.summary: Calls the OnMessage event
member.remarks: The Message parameter is valid only inside the method.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new message receiver object.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.Finalize
member.summary: Frees the message receiver.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.Close
member.summary: Closes the message receiver.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.Open(wclCommon.wclMessageProcessingMethod)
member.summary: Opens the message receiver.
member.param: The message processing method that should be used by the Message Receiver.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.Post(wclCommon.wclMessage,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Places a message to the messages queue and starts processing the messages.
member.param: The object. A caller is responsible to dispose the message object passed into the method.

param.name: Sync
param.para: If the Sync parameter is True and the thread that called the method is the same that used to call the Open method the message will be delivered without placing it to the messages queue.
If the thread that posting the message is different from one that was used to call the Open method or the Sync parameter is False (the default value) the message will be placed to the messages queue.

member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: If sync messages is posted it can be processed before any other messages in the queue.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.ProcessAllMessages
member.summary: Processes all messages in the messages queue.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclPowerEventsMonitor
member.summary: The class allows an application to receive power state changes notifications.
The class allows an application to receive power state changes notifications.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclPowerEventsMonitor.MessageReceived(wclCommon.wclMessage)
member.summary: The method called when a new notification message received.
member.param: A object represents a notification message.

remarks.para: This method is for internal use only.
If a derived class overrides this method it must always call the inherited implementation first.

member.summary: Fires the OnChanged event.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclPowerEventsMonitor.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new object of the wclPowerEventsMonitor class.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclPowerEventsMonitor.Close
member.summary: Stops listening for the power events and releases all resources.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclPowerEventsMonitor.Open
member.summary: Opens the power state changes monitor and starts listening for events.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclPowerEventsMonitor.GetPowerStatus(wclCommon.wclPowerStatus@)
member.summary: Retrieves the power status of the system. The status indicates whether the system is running on AC or DC power, whether the battery is currently charging, how much battery life remains, and if battery saver is on or off.
member.param: A structure that receives status information.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclPowerEventsMonitor.Active
member.summary: Gets the monitor's state.
member.value: true if the power state monitor is listening for power state changes. false otherwise.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclPowerEventsMonitor.MessageProcessing
member.summary: Gets and sets the monitor's message processing method.

member.name: E:wclCommon.wclPowerEventsMonitor.OnPowerStateChanged
member.summary: The event fires when the system's power state has been changed.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclPowerStatus
member.summary: Contains information about the power status of the system.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclPowerStatus.ACLineStatus
member.summary: The AC power status.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclPowerStatus.BatteryChargeStatus
member.summary: The battery charge status. The set is empty if the battery is not being charged and the battery capacity is between low and high.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclPowerStatus.BatteryLifePercent
member.summary: The percentage of full battery charge remaining. This member can be a value in the range 0 to 100, or 255 if status is unknown.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclPowerStatus.BatterySavingState
member.summary: The status of battery saver. False if the battery saver is off. True if the battery saver on. Save energy where possible.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclPowerStatus.BatteryLifeTime
member.summary: The number of seconds of battery life remaining, or 0xFFFFFFFF if remaining seconds are unknown or if the device is connected to AC power.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclPowerStatus.BatteryFullLifeTime
member.summary: The number of seconds of battery life when at full charge, or 0xFFFFFFFF if full battery lifetime is unknown or if the device is connected to AC power.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclPowerState
member.summary: The enumeration defines the system power states.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclPowerState.psPowerStatusChanged
member.summary: The power status of the computer has been changed.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclPowerState.psResumeAutomatic
member.summary: Indicates that the system is resuming from sleep or hibernation. This state is delivered every time the system resumes and does not indicate whether a user is present.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclPowerState.psResume
member.summary: Indicates that the system is resuming from a low-power state. This state appears after psResumeAutomatic if the resume is triggered by user input, such as pressing a key.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclPowerState.psSuspend
member.summary: Indicates that the computer is about to enter a suspended state.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclPowerState.psUnknown
member.summary: Unknown power state.
